thread.title: Chinese yuan strengthens

author: Wires English | Indo-Asian News Service
title: Chinese yuan strengthens
text:
Comments 
Beijing, Oct 13: The central parity rate of the Chinese currency renminbi, or the yuan, strengthened 175 basis points to 6.3231 against the US dollar on Tuesday, authorities said. (Also Read: China launches international payment system to globalise yuan) 
In China’s spot foreign exchange market, the yuan is allowed to rise or fall by 2 percent from the central parity rate each trading day, reported Xinhua news agency.The People’s Bank of China reformed the exchange rate formation system on August 11 to better reflect market development in the exchange rate of the Chinese yuan against the US dollar. 
The central parity rate of the yuan against the US dollar is based on a weighted average of prices offered by market makers before the opening of the market each business day and also refers to the closing rate on the previous day, in conjunction with supply and demand condition and movement of major currencies.
